jorisvandenbossche commented on pull request #7469:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/7469#issuecomment-645364205


   @pitrou what would you think of something like this? 
   
   I saw several times users being confused about the typical AttributeError (eg https://github.com/apache/arrow/issues/7443, https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-8832). 
   This way, we could provide a more informative error message when pyarrow is not built with support for the specific filesystem (the error message in the PR can be further improved then)

##########

##########
@@ -35,14 +36,31 @@
 # For backward compatibility.
 FileStats = FileInfo
 
+_not_imported = []
+
 try:
     from pyarrow._hdfs import HadoopFileSystem  # noqa
 except ImportError:
-    pass
+    _not_imported.append("HadoopFileSystem")
 
 try:
     from pyarrow._s3fs import S3FileSystem, initialize_s3, finalize_s3  # noqa
 except ImportError:
-    pass
+    _not_imported.append("S3FileSystem")
 else:
     initialize_s3()
+
+
+if sys.version_info >= (3, 7):

Review comment:
       I don't think this is required. At worse `__getattr__` is a no-op :-)

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

comments.body:
This is because the current binary wheels don't yet include S3 support (see also comment at https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-7102?focusedCommentId=17077806&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels%3Acomment-tabpanel#comment-17077806). The packaging scripts for wheels need to be updated to also build against the AWS C++ SDK.  
Options to install it right now it to use the conda packages (or install from source).

So it's essentially a packaging task, but the error message you get could be more informative, though.

Thank you very much [~jorisvandenbossche] for your answer.

Should I close this JIRA?
Closing because it is already related to this issue https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-7102
